project_abstract.cdata: The Third Development Industrial Bank Project is designed to (i) provide a part of DIB's foreign exchange requirements over about two years with a special effort to assist small scale industrial (SSI) enterprises; (ii) assist DIB strengthening its development banking functions and related organization and procedures; and (iii) finance a program of technical assistance to SSI through institutions other than DIB. The project will be financed by both the Bank and by a loan of $8.75 million from the OPEC Special Fund (OSF), the latter providing all its funds to SSI projects; SSI financing under the Bank loan is estimated at about 10 percent of the loan proceeds, or about $4 million. At the request of OSF the Bank has agreed to administer the OSF loan. The project does not carry special risks.
